alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, east central Wicomico, Worcester and Accomack Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near West Pocomoke to 6 miles northwest of Parksley to 12 miles northwest of Exmore. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Ocean City, Pocomoke City, Berlin, Snow Hill, Onancock, Parksley, Tangier, Onley, Marion Station, Newark, Lawsonia, Cape Isle Of Wight, Ocean Pines, West Pocomoke, Willards, Accomac, Melfa, Bloxom, Saxis and Wachapreague. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico
